newsitem.title: FRANCE: Accor to set up Spanish hotel venture.
newsitem.headline: Accor to set up Spanish hotel venture.

text.p: French hotel and tourism group Accor said it will set up a joint venture in Spain with the financial holding controlling Spanish hotel chain NH Hoteles.
The agreement signed earlier on Tuesday in Madrid involves the creation of 60 Ibis hotels in Spain over the next five years.
"We must capitalise on the expertise of NH in Spain and Accor's know-how regarding hotel creation," Didier Gros, the joint-chairman of Sphere International, told Reuters.
Gros and Jean-Claude Luttman head Sphere International, the company that groups the budget hotels of the Accor chain.
The 50-50 venture will be headed by NH president Antonio Catalan.
Total investment was put at two billion pesetas. But the initial investment will amount to 20 milion francs, evenly shared by the two partners.
